description: From pixie, with ending as in titillated.

adjectives.description: pixilated (comparative more pixilated, superlative most pixilated)

entries.meaning: behaving in an eccentric manner, as though led by pixies.
examples: Jane Faulkner: They think he's pixilated.

Board member: Perhaps I can explain, your honor. The word "pixilated" is an early American expression derived from the word "pixies", meaning elves. They would say the pixies had got him. As we nowadays would say, a man is "barmy".
